intro: Alyssum microphyllum, commonly known as dwarf alyssum, is a low-growing flowering plant native to the western United States. It is characterized by its dense clusters of small, fragrant white or yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant has small, rounded leaves and thrives in well-drained soil and full sun. It is often used in rock gardens and as a ground cover due to its hardy nature and ornamental value. Alyssum microphyllum is also known for attracting beneficial insects such as ladybugs and lacewings.
